title: Medium Team Format
description: Workshop adaptations for teams of 6-12 people
philosophy: Medium teams balance intimacy with diversity. The strength is having enough perspectives for rich discussion while still maintaining personal connection. Breakout groups enable parallel work, plenaries ensure alignment.

strengths: Enough people for dynamic games and debates
Still small enough for everyone to be heard
challenges: Risk of cliques or subgroups forming

general_adaptations.facilitation: Structured facilitation with clear time boundaries. Mix of breakout and plenary.
general_adaptations.timing: Standard workshop timing. Account for transition time between activities.
general_adaptations.participation: Use breakouts for depth, plenaries for alignment
general_adaptations.games: Split into teams for competitive games, combine for collaborative games
general_adaptations.discussions: Use structured formats (round-robin, fishbowl) to ensure all voices
general_adaptations.synthesis: Representatives from breakouts share with plenary

W1_vision_quest.future_headlines: Pairs write headlines together, then share with full group
W1_vision_quest.stakeholder_safari: Pairs role-play stakeholder interviews with each other
W1_vision_quest.mission_discussion: Small group discussions (3-4), then synthesis in plenary

W2_ethics_arena.dilemma_duel: Split into two teams per dilemma, structured debate format
W2_ethics_arena.value_auction: Team bidding (2-3 teams), forces internal prioritization first
W2_ethics_arena.boundary_discussion: Breakout groups propose boundaries, plenary validates

W3_stack_safari.tech_speed_dating: Rotating pairs or small groups evaluate technologies
W3_stack_safari.tradeoff_tetris: 2-3 parallel boards by sub-team, then merge attempts
W3_stack_safari.architecture_pictionary: Two teams alternate drawing and guessing

W4_agent_assembly.trading_cards: Pairs create cards, then 'card draft' to select team deck
W4_agent_assembly.skill_bingo: Team bingo (2-3 teams), collaborative card filling

W5_integration_celebration.demo_derby: Sub-groups demo their contributions, all celebrate together
W5_integration_celebration.gratitude_circle: Paired gratitudes, then share highlights with group

G1_future_headlines.modification: Pairs write together, doubles idea quality and builds mini-bonds
G1_future_headlines.benefit: Combines perspectives, reduces intimidation of solo writing

G2_stakeholder_safari.modification: Partner interviews - one plays stakeholder, one interviews

G4_dilemma_duel.modification: Full structured debate with two teams, timer, and scoring

G5_value_auction.modification: Teams of 3-4 bid together, must internally agree

G7_agent_trading_cards.modification: Pairs create cards, then draft like a sports team
G7_agent_trading_cards.benefit: Collaboration on creation, excitement in selection

G8_skill_bingo.modification: Team bingo - groups fill cards together

G11_gratitude_circle.modification: Paired gratitude exchanges, then share one highlight each to full group
G11_gratitude_circle.benefit: Intimacy of pairs, efficiency for time

breakout_group_guidelines.rotation: Rotate composition between workshops to build cross-connections
breakout_group_guidelines.roles: Assign: facilitator, note-taker, reporter for each breakout
breakout_group_guidelines.synthesis: Each breakout gets 2-3 minutes to report to plenary

facilitation_tips: Use a visible timer for activities - medium groups need structure
Rotate breakout composition to prevent clique formation
Call on quiet people by name in plenary - they may not self-volunteer
Use sticky notes or digital voting for anonymous input
Have breakout facilitators - don't assume groups self-organize well
Energy checks: use quick polls to gauge engagement
Stand-up activities help when energy drops

plenary_management.speaking_order: Use structured formats - round-robin, popcorn with limit, or raised hands
plenary_management.time_limits: Enforce speaking time limits gently but firmly
plenary_management.engagement: Use audience response (thumbs up, reactions) to keep everyone involved
plenary_management.summarization: AI facilitator synthesizes key points in real-time

success_indicators: All team members contribute in plenary at least once per session
Synthesis captures perspectives from all groups
